title: K3 Retail Solutions Processes - Why!?
text: By having the processes and guidance defined and documented, we can make sure we have: Operational Consistency A single process which everyone is working from. We present a single joined up service to our customers (as opposed to them engaging with different people and having things handled in different ways). Operational Efficiency Process are agreed between support managers to make sure that we are using our resources efficiently (we don't waste time having to re-do things). Operational Risk Mitigation We mitigate the risk of only single people (who may not be available) knowing the process. Continual Improvement We have a baseline to make improvements from (feedback welcome!).
description:
By having the processes and guidance defined and documented, we can make sure we have:

 

Operational Consistency

A single process which everyone is working from.


We present a single joined up service to our customers (as opposed to them engaging with different people and having things handled in different ways).

 

Operational Efficiency

Process are agreed between support managers to make sure that we are using our resources efficiently (we don't waste time having to re-do things).

 

Operational Risk Mitigation

We mitigate the risk of only single people (who may not be available) knowing the process.

 

Continual Improvement

We have a baseline to make improvements from (feedback welcome!).

title: Denmark Timesheets in Freshdesk
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Steps using Freshdesk on a mobile Verification Introduction All staff based in Denmark must follow the procedure below at least weekly to log their time in Freshdesk to comply with employment laws effective 1st July 2024. Danish Law Working time registration requirements are being introduced for employees in general in Denmark. Below is some background information and what it will mean for you. Practicalities. The new Time Registration Act obliges all Danish employers to ensure that employees can register their time as of 1 July 2024 via an objective, reliable and accessible system. The core of the Time Registration Act is to protect employees by ensuring that rules on maximum weekly working hours are respected. The purpose of the Time Registration Act. The new Time Registration Act aims to make it easier for companies to document their compliance with the Working Hours Act. Therefore, the new Time Registration Act aims to ensure that companies comply with working time regulations (Relevant extract): - You may not work more than 48 hours on average per week for a period of four months. - You must have a daily rest period of at least 11 consecutive hours within 24 hours. Full document description can be seen below. Working Time Directive Implementation Act (Working Time Act) Policy Recommended Process Steps using Freshdesk on a browser To get into the system, use this guide: How to login to FreshDesk Each employee has a personalised work card - Timesheets that is divided into the 3 categories. Definition of categories NORMAL WORKNG Hours - This is for hours worked during normal weekday office hours. Callout/Overtime - Log all hours worked when called out during an evening or weekend shift. Only enter the hours actually worked (not waiting for a customer to call). You can also enter any other overtime here. ABSENCE - Log all hours NOT worked due to absence such as being on holiday or off sick against this ticket to comply with Danish law from 1st July 2024. How to find your timesheet in Freshdesk You can find your timesheet by going to company and searching for "DK Timesheet - Name" Select the activity you want to register between the 3 categories. Example. You need to register 7.5 Normal hours for a working day. Click on - Timesheets - Normal Working Hours This opens a ticket and use the bell icon to the right to add your time. Click "Log Time" - Enter HH:MM - 07:30 and select the day you want. Finish by pressing "Save" How to check your registrations in Analytics When you're logged in to Freshdesk, you have direct access to Analytics reports. Click on the Overview icon and select your name. Depending on your needs, you can select "Summary" or "Detail" at the bottom of the report. The "Summary" report is set to show a red colour indicator, which can indicate that you need to consider whether your input is correct. "Detail" gives you the option of specific insights into your data entry. Steps using Freshdesk on a mobile You can also use the Freshdesk Mobile App to enter time as shown in the screenshots below. Log into the mobile App. The first time you log in to the app, you need to do a one-time setup and then you can easily use the app afterwards. From the overview screen, select the Ticket icon. Then select your 3 tickets and choose to "Watch" them. Normal Working Hours Callout/Overtime Absence See screenshots below. You can now select "Tickets I'm Watching" from the menu and you will now have easy access to your DK Timeshifts Tickets. To register your time, select the ticket you want to register the time for. Once you have selected your ticket, use the menu function and select "Log time" You'll find the app very user-friendly and quick to use. Below you can see how easy it is to register your time. Once you have pressed "Log time" you will be taken to the "All logs" menu. Press the plus icon to get to the actual entry. Select your day and enter the desired number of hours. It is important that you make a manual entry. When you think you have entered correctly, remember to "SAVE LOG". Using Analytics on your phone is not recommended. General Notes All timesheet tickets have a "DK-Timesheets" tag to help them to be hidden from ticket views Verification It is each employee's responsibility to ensure that they complete their timesheets using the processes set out above. Every month the Operations Manager checks that all timesheets are complete, using this report: DK Timesheets Management Summary which only managers have access to. Also every month, an extract is automatically sent to management to double-check, and then the contents then sent on to HR for record keeping purposes using this report: DK Timesheet Summary_HR
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Introduction
  • Steps using Freshdesk on a mobile
  • Verification


Introduction

All staff based in Denmark must follow the procedure below at least weekly to log their time in Freshdesk to comply with employment laws effective 1st July 2024.


Danish Law


Working time registration requirements are being introduced for employees in general in Denmark.


Below is some background information and what it will mean for you.


Practicalities.


The new Time Registration Act obliges all Danish employers to ensure that employees can register their time as of 1 July 2024 via an objective, reliable and accessible system.


The core of the Time Registration Act is to protect employees by ensuring that rules on maximum weekly working hours are respected.


The purpose of the Time Registration Act.

The new Time Registration Act aims to make it easier for companies to document their compliance with the Working Hours Act.


Therefore, the new Time Registration Act aims to ensure that companies comply with working time regulations (Relevant extract):


- You may not work more than 48 hours on average per week for a period of four months.


- You must have a daily rest period of at least 11 consecutive hours within 24 hours.

Full document description can be seen below.
Working Time Directive Implementation Act (Working Time Act) Policy 



Recommended Process



Steps using Freshdesk on a browser


To get into the system, use this guide: How to login to FreshDesk


Each employee has a personalised work card - Timesheets that is divided into the 3 categories.


Definition of categories


NORMAL WORKNG Hours - This is for hours worked during normal weekday office hours.


Callout/Overtime - Log all hours worked when called out during an evening or weekend shift. Only enter the hours actually worked (not waiting for a customer to call). You can also enter any other overtime here.


ABSENCE - Log all hours NOT worked due to absence such as being on holiday or off sick against this ticket to comply with Danish law from 1st July 2024. 


How to find your timesheet in Freshdesk


You can find your timesheet by going to company and searching for "DK Timesheet - Name"



Select the activity you want to register between the 3 categories.


Example.


You need to register 7.5 Normal hours for a working day.


Click on - Timesheets - Normal Working Hours 


This opens a ticket and use the bell icon to the right to add your time.




Click "Log Time" - Enter HH:MM - 07:30 and select the day you want. Finish by pressing "Save" 



How to check your registrations in Analytics


When you're logged in to Freshdesk, you have direct access to Analytics reports.

Click on the Overview icon and select your name. Depending on your needs, you can select "Summary" or "Detail" at the bottom of the report.


 

The "Summary" report is set to show a red colour indicator, which can indicate that you need to consider whether your input is correct.


"Detail" gives you the option of specific insights into your data entry.





Steps using Freshdesk on a mobile

You can also use the Freshdesk Mobile App to enter time as shown in the screenshots below.


Log into the mobile App.


The first time you log in to the app, you need to do a one-time setup and then you can easily use the app afterwards.


From the overview screen, select the Ticket icon. Then select your 3 tickets and choose to "Watch" them.


Normal Working Hours

Callout/Overtime

Absence


See screenshots below.

You can now select "Tickets I'm Watching" from the menu and you will now have easy access to your 

DK Timeshifts Tickets.



To register your time, select the ticket you want to register the time for.


Once you have selected your ticket, use the menu function and select "Log time"


You'll find the app very user-friendly and quick to use. Below you can see how easy it is to register your time.


Once you have pressed "Log time" you will be taken to the "All logs" menu.


Press the plus icon to get to the actual entry. Select your day and enter the desired number of hours. 

It is important that you make a manual entry.

When you think you have entered correctly, remember to "SAVE LOG".

Using Analytics on your phone is not recommended.


General Notes

  1. All timesheet tickets have a "DK-Timesheets" tag to help them to be hidden from ticket views


Verification

It is each employee's responsibility to ensure that they complete their timesheets using the processes set out above.


Every month the Operations Manager checks that all timesheets are complete, using this report: DK Timesheets Management Summary which only managers have access to.


Also every month, an extract is automatically sent to management to double-check, and then the contents then sent on to HR for record keeping purposes using this report: DK Timesheet Summary_HR
